channel.title: NHC Atlantic
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Atlantic, Caribbean, and the Gulf of Mexico

item.title: Atlantic Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
000
ABNT20 KNHC 141118
TWOAT

TROPICAL WEATHER OUTLOOK
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
800 AM EDT TUE JUL 14 2015

For the North Atlantic...Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico:

The National Hurricane Center is issuing advisories on Tropical
Storm Claudette, located a few hundred miles south Halifax, Nova
Scotia.

Tropical cyclone formation is not expected during the next 5 days.

$$
Forecaster Avila
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Summary for Tropical Storm CLAUDETTE (AT3/AL032015)
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
item.description: ...CLAUDETTE WEAKENING... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME POST-TROPICAL TONIGHT... As of 11:00 AM AST Tue Jul 14 the center of CLAUDETTE was located near 41.4, -61.3 with movement NE at 21 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 40 mph.

item.title: Tropical Storm CLAUDETTE Public Advisory Number 5
item.description:
Issued at 1100 AM AST TUE JUL 14 2015 

000
WTNT33 KNHC 141447
TCPAT3

BULLETIN
TROPICAL STORM CLAUDETTE ADVISORY NUMBER   5
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015
1100 AM AST TUE JUL 14 2015

...CLAUDETTE WEAKENING...
...EXPECTED TO BECOME POST-TROPICAL TONIGHT...


SUMMARY OF 1100 AM AST...1500 UTC...INFORMATION
-----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...41.4N 61.3W
ABOUT 250 MI...400 KM SSE OF HALIFAX NOVA SCOTIA
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...40 MPH...65 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...NE OR 50 DEGREES AT 21 MPH...33 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1005 MB...29.68 INCHES


WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.


DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK
------------------------------
At 1100 AM AST (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Claudette
was located near latitude 41.4 North, longitude 61.3 West. Claudette
is moving toward the northeast near 21 mph (33 km/h).  A turn
toward the north-northeast with some further increase in forward
speed is expected through Wednesday.

Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 40 mph (65 km/h) with
higher gusts. Additional weakening is likely, and Claudette is
expected to become a post-tropical cyclone tonight.  Dissipation is
forecast on Wednesday.

Tropical storm force winds extend outward up to 70 miles (110 km)
from the center.

The estimated minimum central pressure is 1005 mb (29.68 inches).


HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None


NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 500 PM AST.

$$
Forecaster Kimberlain
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm CLAUDETTE Forecast Advisory Number 5
item.description:
Issued at 1500 UTC TUE JUL 14 2015 

000
WTNT23 KNHC 141447
TCMAT3

TROPICAL STORM CLAUDETTE FORECAST/ADVISORY NUMBER   5
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015
1500 UTC TUE JUL 14 2015

THERE ARE NO COASTAL WATCHES OR WARNINGS IN EFFECT.

TROPICAL STORM CENTER LOCATED NEAR 41.4N  61.3W AT 14/1500Z
POSITION ACCURATE WITHIN  30 NM

PRESENT MOVEMENT TOWARD THE NORTHEAST OR  50 DEGREES AT  18 KT

ESTIMATED MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE 1005 MB
MAX SUSTAINED WINDS  35 KT WITH GUSTS TO  45 KT.
34 KT....... 60NE  60SE   0SW  20NW.
12 FT SEAS.. 60NE 120SE  60SW   0NW.
WINDS AND SEAS VARY GREATLY IN EACH QUADRANT.  RADII IN NAUTICAL
MILES ARE THE LARGEST RADII EXPECTED ANYWHERE IN THAT QUADRANT.

REPEAT...CENTER LOCATED NEAR 41.4N  61.3W AT 14/1500Z
AT 14/1200Z CENTER WAS LOCATED NEAR 40.7N  62.0W

FORECAST VALID 15/0000Z 43.6N  59.0W
MAX WIND  30 KT...GUSTS  40 KT.

FORECAST VALID 15/1200Z 46.7N  56.8W...POST-TROP/EXTRATROP
MAX WIND  30 KT...GUSTS  40 KT.

FORECAST VALID 16/0000Z...DISSIPATED

REQUEST FOR 3 HOURLY SHIP REPORTS WITHIN 300 MILES OF 41.4N  61.3W

NEXT ADVISORY AT 14/2100Z

$$
FORECASTER KIMBERLAIN
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm CLAUDETTE Forecast Discussion Number 5
item.description:
Issued at 1100 AM AST TUE JUL 14 2015 

000
WTNT43 KNHC 141451
TCDAT3

TROPICAL STORM CLAUDETTE DISCUSSION NUMBER   5
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015
1100 AM AST TUE JUL 14 2015

Claudette's cloud pattern is rapidly becoming less organized. Deep
convection continues to burst northeast of the low-level center,
with the latter becoming increasingly exposed and diffuse this
morning. The cyclone's current structure is symptomatic of deep
layer of southwesterly shear of over 30 kt, as diagnosed by SHIPS
model analyses. Dvorak classifications were T2.0/30 kt and T2.5/35
kt from SAB and TAFB at 1200 UTC, respectively. The initial
intensity is lowered to 35 kt, at the higher end of these estimates
due to the storm's increasing forward speed. Claudette has already
passed the northern wall of the Gulf Stream and will be moving
over sea surface temperatures below 20 deg C soon.  Cooler waters, a
much more stable and drier atmosphere, and continued strong
southwesterly shear should contribute to Claudette's weakening.
Global models suggest that extratropical transition should occur in
about 24 hours, with the system opening up into a trough shortly
after that.  The official intensity forecast is in excellent
agreement with the multi-model consensus.

The initial motion estimate is 050/18.  Prior to dissipation
tomorrow, Claudette's track should turn north-northeastward with
some additional acceleration while it rotates around large
deep-layer cyclone over eastern Canada.  The latest track forecast
has changed little from the previous one.


FORECAST POSITIONS AND MAX WINDS

INIT  14/1500Z 41.4N  61.3W   35 KT  40 MPH
 12H  15/0000Z 43.6N  59.0W   30 KT  35 MPH
 24H  15/1200Z 46.7N  56.8W   30 KT  35 MPH...POST-TROP/EXTRATROP
 36H  16/0000Z...DISSIPATED

$$
Forecaster Kimberlain
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm CLAUDETTE Wind Speed Probabilities Number 5
item.description:
Issued at 1500 UTC TUE JUL 14 2015 

000
FONT13 KNHC 141450
PWSAT3
                                                                    
TROPICAL STORM CLAUDETTE WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES NUMBER   5        
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015               
1500 UTC TUE JUL 14 2015                                            
                                                                    
AT 1500Z THE CENTER OF TROPICAL STORM CLAUDETTE WAS LOCATED NEAR    
LATITUDE 41.4 NORTH...LONGITUDE 61.3 WEST WITH MAXIMUM SUSTAINED    
WINDS NEAR 35 KTS...40 MPH...65 KM/H.                               
                                                                    
Z INDICATES COORDINATED UNIVERSAL TIME (GREENWICH)                  
   ATLANTIC STANDARD TIME (AST)...SUBTRACT 4 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
   EASTERN  DAYLIGHT TIME (EDT)...SUBTRACT 4 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
   CENTRAL  DAYLIGHT TIME (CDT)...SUBTRACT 5 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
                                                                    
WIND SPEED PROBABILITY TABLE FOR SPECIFIC LOCATIONS                 
                                                                    
CHANCES OF SUSTAINED (1-MINUTE AVERAGE) WIND SPEEDS OF AT LEAST     
   ...34 KT (39 MPH... 63 KM/H)...                                  
   ...50 KT (58 MPH... 93 KM/H)...                                  
   ...64 KT (74 MPH...119 KM/H)...                                  
FOR LOCATIONS AND TIME PERIODS DURING THE NEXT 5 DAYS               
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES FOR LOCATIONS ARE GIVEN AS OP(CP) WHERE               
    OP  IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT BEGINNING DURING            
        AN INDIVIDUAL TIME PERIOD (ONSET PROBABILITY)               
   (CP) IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT OCCURRING BETWEEN           
        12Z TUE AND THE FORECAST HOUR (CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY)      
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES ARE GIVEN IN PERCENT                                  
X INDICATES PROBABILITIES LESS THAN 1 PERCENT                       
PROBABILITIES FOR 34 KT AND 50 KT ARE SHOWN AT A GIVEN LOCATION WHEN
THE 5-DAY CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 3 PERCENT.             
PROBABILITIES FOR 64 KT ARE SHOWN WHEN THE 5-DAY CUMULATIVE         
PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 1 PERCENT.                                  
                                                                    
                                                                    
  - - - - WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES FOR SELECTED LOCATIONS - - - -   
                                                                    
               FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM 
  TIME       12Z TUE 00Z WED 12Z WED 00Z THU 12Z THU 12Z FRI 12Z SAT
PERIODS         TO      TO      TO      TO      TO      TO      TO  
             00Z WED 12Z WED 00Z THU 12Z THU 12Z FRI 12Z SAT 12Z SUN
                                                                    
FORECAST HOUR    (12)   (24)    (36)    (48)    (72)    (96)   (120)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
LOCATION       KT

ILE ST PIERRE  34  X  24(24)   X(24)   X(24)   X(24)   X(24)   X(24)
